View on the Lima. Very clean on cobblestones.

title: () Viana do Castelo - Marginal
description: Quiet place to sleep, beach in front.

title: (4935) Darque - 1851 Avenida do Cabedelo
description:
Supply and disposal of the community, very clean and well organized. It also has 2 open air showers. All around there are several pitches for mobile homes.

The guarded beach is 150 meters away, along the way there are several free cold showers and toilets (from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m.). There are also two restaurants.

50 meters from the car park, two passenger ferries leave every hour on the opposite side of the river

title: (4900-858) Viana do Castelo - 347 Rua da Veiga
title_short: (4900-858) Viana do Castelo - 347 Rua da Veiga
description: Directly close to one of the many beaches of Viana de Castelo.  Incredible number of places available for all sizes.  Here but in the entire area you can park in various parking lots and streets.  Near a popular bar / restaurant with wifi and a beautiful view over the river 'Lima'.

title: () Viana do Castelo - Av. do Cabedelo

description: Self-service washing machines. Very clean store and fair prices.

description: Nice new laundromat with clean machines

title: (4900) Viana do Castelo - Rua da Veiga
title_short: (4900) Viana do Castelo - Rua da Veiga
description: At the edge of a small quiet boat harbor with possible swimming 1km from the city. Day and night. Wild corner

title: (4935-161) Viana do Castelo - 224 Rua Diogo Cão
title_short: (4935-161) Viana do Castelo - 224 Rua Diogo Cão
description: Relatively quiet parking close to the beach. The toilets and showers are within walking distance. The toilets open at 09:00 and close at 18:00. There are lockable shower stalls in the toilet. From 18:00, showers on the beach are possible (as well as filling in fresh water). During the day a little crowded with visitors. Surf shop and cafes nearby. Fresh water and sanitation for the big campers of the opposite river.

title: (4900-351) Viana do Castelo - 59 Avenida de Cabo Verde
title_short: (4900-351) Viana do Castelo - 59 Avenida de Cabo Verde
description: parking without services

title: (4900-858) Viana do Castelo -

name: Parque Campismo INATEL Cabedelo

description: Parque Campismo INATEL Cabedelo! Camping with access to the beach. Cheaper than the one next door (van 2ad 2enf electricity 13.95). New sanitary.

name: Orbitur Camping
title: (4935) Orbitur Camping
description: Secure direct access to the beach. Swimming pool. Nice campsite for (wind) surfers. Relatively expensive.

title_short: (4900) Viana do Castelo - 9 Rua da Boa Viagem
description: Local name: Poço Negro. Local quiet place with small waterfalls and natural swimming pools. Completely empty (except in the summer peak). There’s a few roads where you can safely park in the shadow.

title: (4935-085) Viana do Castelo - R. da Sobreira
title_short: (4935-085) Viana do Castelo - R. da Sobreira
description: Just flat pitches, no bans. Perfect for spending the night there. Trash Cans Nearby

title: (4900) Viana do Castelo -
description: Simple relatively flat area in front of a village (not in sight) surrounded by nature. In the village there are toilets, a picnic area and even showers (don't know if they still work). From here you can make great hikes even to the St Lucia of Viana or along old watercourses. We discovered the place on a hike, but you can probably spend the night there without any problems. More pitches sheltered from the wind directly opposite.

title: (4900) Viana do Castelo - 52-72 Rua do Covelo
title_short: (4900) Viana do Castelo - 52-72 Rua do Covelo
description: Laundry in Internmarche supermarket, ample parking

title: (M59H+3Q) Viana do Castelo - Unnamed Road
description: Nature place, close to Rodanho beach, for a lunch break or a walk on the beach.

title: (4935) - Rua das Sargaceiras
description: Spectacular site 100 meters from the beach. Surfers and good atmosphere. We are told that the GNR does not fine because it is the responsibility of the maritime police.

name: Brejuinha - Feel The Nature
title: (4935-401) Brejuinha - Feel The Nature
description: It is a Quinta managed by very nice people where you can sleep one night very comfortably and in silence for free if you consume something in their bar as normal, magnificent by the way. You have all the services even showers, consulting them with affection. La Quinta is open from Tuesday to Sunday.

title: (4900) Viana do Castelo -
description: Beautiful spot to park and sleep. In the middle of a mountain road that leads to the top of the mountain where there are many trials and space for cycling or motocross. Very calm, almost no traffic. Pure silence in the night.

title: (4935) Mazarefes - 8147 N203
description: Toilet in the Lidl for Lidl customers

title: (4900) Viana do Castelo - Unnamed Road
description: Great nature spot if you want to be completely alone in the wild up high overlooking the coast - found this on a mountain bike ride requires some off road access but a van would be ok (just checking to see if there are road directions), will update if access is ok

title: (4900) - Rua do Lumiar
description: Great spot to park right in the front of the beach! It's a pavmented parking place with good access and quiet! Not that much other campers parking here, which is perfect! Nice place to get a walk at the sunset because there's a wooden walkside with several kms! Great place to joy the sea nature! Not the best place to do swim at the sea because it,s plenty of rocks!

title: () - 58 Rua do Lumiar
description: Nice place to stop for the day and night. Beautiful sunset. Paved road access, no convenience, no water, no electricity.

title: () Mazarefes - Rua do Passal
description: Intermarché supermarket with service area and gas station. Very clean, stayed overnight, very quiet, only one other motorhome, would recommend

description: Public parking day and night. There is a bar/restaurant by the beach less then 5 minutes north where there are showers and water (not sure if drinkable). Right by the beach, stunning views and great walks for miles.  Very quiet at night but lots of people during the day.

title: (4935-580) - 123 Avenida da Bela Vista
description: Beach near Viana do Castelo.

title: (4900) - 112 Avenida da Praia
description: Mixed parking. Next to a beautiful and quiet beach. Showers and restaurant next door. Perfect to spend the day or night. Super quiet

title: (4935) Chafé - 33 Avenida Marginal
description: Next to the beach, with showers coming out of the sand, several shops nearby

title: (4900) Carreço - 336 Rua de Mogada

title: (4935-580) Chafé - 28 Avenida da Praia
description: Good laundrette that is open long hours 7 days per week. NB cash only.

title: (4935-580) Portugal - 35 Avenida da Praia
description: Perfect quiet spot next to the beach with outside showers and toilets. We stayed for the night, not sure if it is allowed but no control.

title: (4900) - 53 Rua de Suavila
description: At the end of a small road, some parking spaces to park with sea view. Quiet (just the sound of the waves!). No on-site service. Small vehicle only

title: (4935-580) Chafé - 1619a Rua da Amorosa
description: A nice and quiet place, right in front of sea.

title: (4935) Vila Franca - Unnamed Road
description: Free parking, in theory it is for sports activity. We spent the afternoon watching surfers and the night quiet and alone with no problems.

title: (4900) Carreço - 769 Avenida de Paço
description: An amazing Albergue to visit with dorm beds available too. The owner, Hugo is fantastic and his sidekick, Alex, extremely helpful. They have a dining area (indoor and outdoor), pool and very clean bathrooms and showers. And a Weber BBQ too!! There is space for up to four campers/overlanders. Cyclists with tents also welcomed. Bars, social clubs, mini market and an ace restaurant super close. Sea views and mountains with wild horses easily accessible. Loved this place!!

title: (4935) Lordelo - 31 Rua da Amorosa
description: Gas station with water (free), toilets and a vacuum cleaner (not free). Small shop.

title: (4935) Vila Franca - Estrada de Manuel Espregueira
title_short: (4935) Vila Franca - Estrada de Manuel Espregueira
description: Nice place by the river under the eucalyptus trees with picnic tables, no problem to spend the night. Can turn left or right at the end of this paved road - right seems to have more morning activity. Locals come to fish and is super calm and quiet in early September. 4G signal! Fairly bumpy and narrow approach (may not be suitable for large campers over 6m).

title: (4935) Lordelo - Unnamed Road
description: Really nice spot directly at the beach - it’s the end of a rough road but easy to drive on.

title: (4900) - Unnamed Road
description: Large parking flat beach supervised snack wc water beach shower

title: (4935) - 1667 Rua das Dunas

title: (4900-012) Afife - Caminho da Arda
description: Arda playa Afife, surf and bathing beach, beach bar, toilets open the day

title: (4935-572) Castelo do Neiva - Rua das Algas
title_short: (4935-572) Castelo do Neiva - Rua das Algas
description: Parking alternative to the motorhome area. 15 places. Good for overnight. Near beach .

title: (4900) - Caminho da Arda
description: Second parking of Praia de Arda. Quiet and spacious. Today we will sleep here. Thank you Portugal for welcoming the ACs so well. No restrictive signs or 1984 Big Brother style police check

title: (4900) - Unnamed Road
description: Only ocean facing ocean no service but quiet. Surf nearby. Will surely come back. Leave the car park on your right continue for 100m, and you will be alone.

title: (4900) Afife - Unnamed Road
description: Great quiet place, about 20m to the beach without rocks. Beach shower and water nearby. Perfect !

title: (4905) Deocriste - Veigas
description:
Situated right next to the river (strong current but possibility to walk just halfway in), there is plenty of space and a pretty landscape (if not for the rubbish, that sadly spoils a few of the surounding spots) and possibilities for children as well as for adults to play and explore.

There's a pipeline that leads down to the banks of the river Lima, it belongs to a nearby factory (that's also a little audible but has quite a decent sound). Also, there are plenty of gangplanks and benches with tables on the adjacent lawn, with even another possible parking spot next to it (to the right from the driveway).

The parking spaces are unpaved but mostly even. The driveway is slightly bumpy. It should all be fine for buses or smaller vans. There is a low-hanging tree over the driveway, but with only soft twigs coming in your way.

title: (4900) Afife - Unnamed Road
description: Parking of Afife beach. Easy to access and quiet. Many places. We spent the night at five motorhomes.

title: (4900) - CM1162
description: Parking day and night very quiet.

title: (4910) Vila Praia de Âncora -
description: Nice spot with view in the forest on a hill. Some benches to have picknic, also protected from the wind

title: (4740-018) Esposende - 27 Rua do Neiva
description: Fiero Alto car park- free car park by the side of a river in a quiet residential area. Boardwalk along river and to beach nearby. We stayed on a Saturday night and were the only ones there. Also quiet on the Sunday morning although was raining. No problems staying- we saw a couple of dog walkers and a drunk couple who turned up to do some fishing at 2am!

title: (4925) Freixieiro de Soutelo -
description: Very pleasant place and possible to park with a fitted out bus or fitted out heavy goods vehicle. wild animals like horses to see if you are lucky to see it next to you like we were

name: Sereia da Gelfa
title: (4910) Sereia da Gelfa
description: Nice and big camping, quiet in winter, probably a lot more busy in summer. Sanitaries are clean, staff is friendly and prices cheap.  Lot of activities around, bar and restaurant looks quite fancy.

name: Azenha do Grilo - Rio Neiva
title: (4740-018) Azenha do Grilo - Rio Neiva
description: Stay over day or overnight on Azenha do Grilo, Antas - Esposende.                            Suggestion- PR4 - TRAIL OF ANTAS WATERMILLS                                                      A journey of heritage, architecture, religion, archeology, ethnography and nature. The name comes from the various devices can be found along the river.

title: (4925) Viana do Castelo - Rua Portinho dos Bois
title_short: (4925) Viana do Castelo - Rua Portinho dos Bois
description: Pretty location by the river, you can swim if you go up the river by a path that runs along it. A resident told us we could leave the camper 24 hours without worries. The police also came to give us recommendations for the fire because the risks of fire are high.

title: (4910-013) Âncora - Avenida Forte do Cão
description:
Space for 3-4 campers. next to the sea and with great views.
Quiet place at night and with little light, ideal to sleep with the whisper of the waves.
500 meters from a parking lot that has outdoor showers, bathrooms open 24 hours and the Camarão restaurant located at the foot of the beach.
From that car park you can walk along a wooden path of about 2 km to go to Vila praia de Âncora.

title: (4925-326) Amonde - 1375 N305
description: In nature

name: Camping Park Camping Paço
title: (4910-024) Camping Park Camping Paço
description: PC Do Paço. Camping full of charm and reasonable price. Very wooded and bordered by a beautiful river to which you can access through a door in the fence at the bar (small waterfall nice and refreshing!).

title_short: (4910-013) Águas Férreas - A5 Travessa da Areia
description: Intermarché with washing machines and dryer, parking with space for some camper, just passing to wash clothes and make purchases, behind there is an antique shop with local objects very cheap

title_short: (4905) Moreira de Geraz do Lima - Caminho Marginal Rio Lima
description: Bivouac by the river, easy access for 4x4, van, but not for camper. Tarmac road slightly sandy. Places for several vehicles.

title: (4740) Belinho -
description: Quelques places de parking à plat. Quelques voitures de pêcheurs. Juste devant l’océan. Baignade possible. Bien rester sur la piste en dur. Attention au sable et galets, pour ne pas rester enlisé.

title_short: (4910-011) Águas Férreas - 362 Rua de Águas Férreas

title: (4910) - EM526-1

title: (4925) - EM526

description: Nice site with waterfall

title_short: (4910-505) Vila Praia de Âncora - 287 Rua Doutor Mesquita da Silva
description: Service area in the center next to the bus station, but without a parking area only for emptying and filling

title: (4740-166) Belinho - Unnamed Road
description: Dream spot at the top of a hill close to a sanctuary! ideal for lovers of nature and calm. the land is flat and can accommodate up to 3 vans. the spot is in a basin, ideal when the weather is nice, sheltered from the wind! surrounded by very pretty vegetation and under maritime pines and mimoza! you can see the sea in the distance. ps: no waste on the spot. Please pick up ALL your trash.

title: (4740) Belinho - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful clean location, with panoramic views, very quiet night (1 car only at night), exceptional sunrise with sea of ​​clouds, no services except a trash, the bottom of the car park is almost flat, but for the rest it is necessary holds

title: (4740) - 93 Rua da Praia
description: Dream location overlooking the sea and in addition easy fishing at mussels excellent for the meal. Easy access. Nobody if it is some octopus fishermen. On the rocks.

title: (4910-547) Vila Praia de Âncora - 297- A Avenida Doutor Ramos Pereira
title_short: (4910-547) Vila Praia de Âncora - 297- A Avenida Doutor Ramos Pereira
description: Lava&Seca self service laundry

title: (4910) Praia de Ancora - 107 Rua de São Pedro de Varais
title_short: (4910) Praia de Ancora - 107 Rua de São Pedro de Varais
description: Area for pernoitar, sossegado and with garden and water. next coffee item

address.street: 107 Rua de São Pedro de Varais

title: (4905) Moreira de Geraz do Lima - Veigas
title_short: (4905) Moreira de Geraz do Lima - Veigas
description: Spacy unpaved area right next to the river Lima, the ground wavy but you should be able to position your vehicle evenly. Some thirty metres away there are houses, but it doesn't feel like parking in their garden. You can take some steps into the river, but beware if its strong current! There's a boat landing, but only some three or four boats lie there. Traffic noises are audible in the distance. Of course some people, also youngsters, pass by and enjoy the place. All in all, for me it was a quite agreeable mixture of private and taking notice of civilisation. The access road is unproblematic for medium-sized vehicles, except for the last meters that are quite bumpy so you better go pretty slow there.

title: (4925) - CM1179
description: Beautiful spot to stay overnight at the village Montaria at Serra D’Arga. From here you have several hikes departures including the PR5 to Pincho Waterfalls. Restaurants, bars and mini-markets around. Super quite at night!!

title: (4910-531) Vila Praia de Âncora - 290 Rua de Bulhente
title_short: (4910-531) Vila Praia de Âncora - 290 Rua de Bulhente
description:
Picnic park with tables, water, toilets and coffee.
Excellent view over the city and the beach.
It has a viewpoint and the "love" swing
Parking and possible access for motorhomes.

title: (4905) Moreira de Geraz do Lima - Veigas
title_short: (4905) Moreira de Geraz do Lima - Veigas
description: Next to the Lanheses Dock, this lovely riverside spot is a gem to park your motorhome for a day or a night. Access is also easy with larger mobile homes. The dock has its own paved car park, however these are too narrow and preferred by the locals, so use the gravel/grass space on the left (max 3 RVs). Lots of people walk and bike during the day, but it's quiet at night. Picnic tables, hiking trails, green river landscape. At the end of the playground on the left, in the direction of the village, there is an outhouse.

title: (4925) Montaria - 414 CM1179
description: A parking lot, without prohibition signs or the like - a good starting point for hikes. The waterfalls start right around the corner and offer a good opportunity for swimming! We spent a very quiet night here! Wide driveway.

title: (4740) - Unnamed Road
description: Camping certainly not allowed. Sandy parking lot behind the fields accessible via dirt roads. Sand space is used by beach visitors during the day. Mostly locals. Nice view depending on the parking situation.

title: (4910) Orbacém -
description: Side of road with no homes around

title: (4910-435) Vila Praia de Âncora - 10 Bairro dos Pescadores
title_short: (4910-435) Vila Praia de Âncora - 10 Bairro dos Pescadores
description:
A place practically in the center of the city, I love it, super quiet and with all the amenities nearby, I highly recommend it, it's quiet.
Length limit 5 meters

title: (4910-441) Vila Praia de Âncora - 171 Largo da Estação
title_short: (4910-441) Vila Praia de Âncora - 171 Largo da Estação

description: Very calm place to eat with a really nice view

description:
Park in a small village with a dozen picnic tables, games for children, basketball hoop, facility for physical exercises, small soccer field, laundry...
Quiet and shaded area.
We only had a picnic there, but we could spend the night there.

title: (4910-523) Vila Praia de Âncora - 103 Rua António Pedro
title_short: (4910-523) Vila Praia de Âncora - 103 Rua António Pedro
description: 2 parking spaces

title: (4910) - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful picnic area next to an old church. Water, benches, bins, barbecues and toilets (currently closed) available. Nice views. Possible to sleep.

title: (4740-511) - 20 Avenida da Praia
description: Parking (field) behind the dune between the vegetable gardens and the ocean. Open and (relatively) clean toilets.

title: () Marinhas -
description: Beautiful place with fabulous views at the Capela da Senhora da Paz. Last 50 meters very steep, but everything paved. We were there from Saturday evening to Sunday. Since the point is obviously taken like a hang. There were certainly over the evening and the night distributed to the other 10 cars, which usually remained between half an hour and an hour. The evenings usually go as high as the crazy, so probably the tire marks on the road. name: Cabanas-Esposende
title: (4740) Cabanas-Esposende
description:
S. LOURENÇO, VILA CHÃ - ESPOSENDE PANORAMIC VIEW
Highest points of the fossil cliffs, line that separates the coastal plain of the first reliefs over the spring. You can see a vast expanse around! For the sides of the Sea, the view can stretch up to Esposende and Fão, and perhaps distinguish the famous "Fão Horses," those rocks always beaten by the waves. If you follow the line marked by the Cávado, you may understand its tortuous passage through the fertile fields which gives life and freshness. There, far away, Mills S. Felix. Closer, another hill as that where you are, Mount Faro. But the landscape to the east also has its charms: for more than three dozen kilometers, if the weather permits, you distinguish a good part of the topography of the Minho, to the Sameiro, as to the sides of Braga. And the north, another high point, more of a fossil cliff promontory, the Mount of Facho.                                                                         S. LOURENÇO INTERPRETIVE CENTER
The Interpretive Center of S. Lourenço (ICFTU), located in the municipality of Esposende, is a permanent institution, non-profit, which will be at the service of society, contributing to its progress. Aims to promote the cultural dynamics of an important archaeological site comprising the castro of St. Lawrence and an area which includes the surrounding area. Intends to leverage this attractive hub of the city, working with the scientific community information for educational and recreational purposes. The building also houses the Office of Cultural Heritage Authority that, in addition to the studies on the archaeological and historical heritage of the county, invests heavily in Educational Service directed a wide range of audiences. The ICFTU has two display areas: within permanent, which is intended sensory and interactive with the public, promotes the framework of space and transformations of the territory.Starts with the evolution of Fossil Cliff and human settlement until the Bronze Age, providing information about the binomial resources occupancy. Through a multimedia game and a movie titled "Caturo, the little warrior" the visitor is attracted to the evolution of the occupation of the archaeological site. The temporary exhibition area of ​​betting on the value of archeology and its importance in the investigation of the occupation of the hill of St. Lawrence. Make known St. Lawrence, as well as traditions associated with this location. Starting from the four principal occupation displays some of the booty recovered from the excavations. For this space was designed expository structure that promotes greater exhibition area, which is intended more settled.

Pic nic area with parking, in the nature. Super beautiful and calm!
There are picnic tables and benches, a barbecue area, with sink. The toilets were closed, but the building seems quite new.
It's right at the Coura river where you can go for a shallow swim, super idilic.
Beware of the access, because the path is a bit steep and bumpy, and right at the curve. We have a 6m motorhome, and it worked for us.

name: Playa Camping Santa Tecla
title: (36789) Playa Camping Santa Tecla
description: We are a 1st Category Camping located in the Miño River estuary a few meters from its mouth. We have more than 500 camping pitches, bungalows and rooms. Possibility of spending the night in our campsite with a 40% discount. Among the services: swimming pool, supermarket, restaurant, mini golf, recreation area, emptying chemical toilets, showers, laundry...

We spent one night and there was no one else so we left, the second night there was another motorhome and we stayed. It is a place surrounded by nature, very quiet, but very lonely if there is no one else. The good thing is that it is very well leveled and is beautiful at night. The downside is that you get there by a dirt road that is a bit uncomfortable because of the potholes.
